title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Friday, July 28 (game #550)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Google’s AirTag stalking alerts are rolling out now to Android phones
description: Android phones will keep an eye out for unwanted Bluetooth trackers and recommend what you can do after finding one.

title: Sony's WF-1000XM5 and WH-1000XM5 audio device gain a performance boost
description: The firmware patch adds multiple upgrades like head tracking to the XM5 headphones and LE audio for the XM5 earbuds.

title: WhatsApp will save you from typing fatigue via its new video messages feature
description: You're now able to send 60 second video messages, but the clips are confined to a small space.

title: AI “doesn’t allow" for "creativity” says Baldur’s Gate 3 voice actor
description: In an interview with TRG, the voice actors for two of Baldur's Gate 3's main characters spoke out about the danger AI poses to their industry.

title: Nvidia reportedly cans the RTX 4090 Ti, but more mid-range GPUs may still be coming
description: A new leak reveals that Nvidia could be canning the long-rumored RTX 4090 Ti graphics card and instead releasing more mid-range cards.

title: Nearly half of Ubuntu users could be vulnerable to these security flaws
description: Eight Ubuntu vulnerabilities have been patched in this latest update, with two relating to OverlayFS.

title: Photoshop has a new AI-powered fix for your compositional mistakes
description: Photoshop has been given another AI-powered upgrade in the form of Generative Expand – here's how to use it.

title: Spaceplan's dev 'hated how it looked' so decided to remaster the entire game
description: The free update for Spaceplan will be available on iOS, Android, and Steam.

title: Fluance's new affordable turntable could be what you've been waiting for – I'll take one in walnut
description: Fluance has upgraded its RT81 starter turntable making the new RT81+ a solid choice for everyone, including beginners.

title: Surfshark VPN launches Alternative ID tool
description: The VPN provider enables users to sign in to online services without giving away their sensitive data. Here's all you need to know.

title: SEC rules companies now have to report breaches within 4 days
description: Goal of SEC move is to protect investors, but some believe hackers could use the disclosures to cause even more problems.

title: Assassin's Creed Codename Hexe release date, setting, story, and everything we know
description: There's a lot to learn about Assassin's Creed Codename Hexe, but we've pulled together everything you ought to know so far.

title: Apple’s iPhone 14 Pro camera is almost certainly coming to the iPhone 15 and 15 Plus
description: Apple is expected to finally equip all iPhones with high-resolution cameras from the iPhone 15 onwards, matching Android rivals.

title: NVIDIA Reflex can give you a competitive edge in shooters like Overwatch 2 and Apex Legends
description: NVIDIA Reflex makes dynamic changes to lower latency in compatible games, eliminating one of the critical challenges for competitive players.

title: Microsoft could finally be cutting down on this security flaw
description: Firmware Analysis is coming to the Microsoft Defender tool, and is currently in Public Preview.

title: Lords of the Fallen shows it's more than an Elden Ring clone in new preview trailer
description: Lords of the Fallen developer Hexworks has unveiled 20 minutes of footage from their upcoming soulslike, showing that there's more to this title than meets the eye.

title: OnePlus piggybacks on Galaxy Z Fold 5 launch to confirm name of its own foldable
description: OnePlus’s foldable phone really will be called the OnePlus Open, the company hinted on the ex-Twitter social network, X.

title: Facebook is being flooded with fake ads that are actually malware
description: ChatGPT and Bard users are being targeted by fake Facebook ads that look to steal your information.

title: The Sims-like open-world Life By You has had early access delayed into 2024
description: Paradox's Sims competitor Life By You has been pushed back into 2024 for its early access.

title: The Samsung Fold 5 is barely a day old, but a rival already plans to upstage its camera
description: A day after Samsung Unpacked, Xiaomi announces a folding phone that might put the Galaxy Z Fold 5 to shame when it comes to the camera.

title: AWS expands Bedrock to help make AI actually useful for your business
description: Building generative AI applications using AWS Bedrock just got even easier with more models added.

title: A Final Fantasy 14 turntable now exists, and it’s the best gaming/audio collab of 2023
description: A record player to celebrate and enjoy the seminal MMO, Final Fantasy XIV, is emphatically the best gaming merch of the year.

title: Samsung says generative AI is coming to Galaxy phones, tablets and watches
description: Samsung Unpacked was light on AI announcements, but the tech giant says it's 'deeply developing' the tech for Galaxy devices.

title: Google Chrome could get a feature that changes the way you browse the web
description: We don’t often get excited about web browser features – but this possible Chrome change is a big one.

title: The iPhone 15 Pro’s Action Button might be capable of nine different things
description: The latest iOS 17 beta mentions nine different functions the iPhone 15 Pro's rumored Action Button may be able to trigger.

title: Desperate for dark mode with Microsoft’s Bing AI chatbot? It’s now here
description: Dark mode has been a much-requested feature for the chatbot, and it’s finally rolling out for everyone.

title: Sharp jumps on the QD-OLED TV bandwagon with new premium Dolby Atmos models
description: Sharp follows in the footsteps of Samsung and Sony in launching its first ever QD-OLED TV.

title: Exclusive: Samsung explains why it dropped iOS support on the Galaxy Watch
description: Samsung executive Junho Park has elaborated on the company’s decision to drop iOS support on the Galaxy Watch line.

title: Slack went down again - here's what happened
description: It's not just you - Slack wasn't working for some users earlier today.

title: The ESRB has begun work on "facial age verification" tech for age checks
description: New facial age verification tech has been proposed by pan-American video games rating authority, the ESRB.

title: Many tech workers are set to quit in the next six months
description: IT workers are feeling the added pressure, with many considering walking out in the next six months.

title: Ratchet and Clank: Rift Apart receives Steam Deck verification
description: Ratchet and Clank: Rift Apart has been rated as "Great on Deck" which means it's ideal for Valve's Steam Deck handheld.

title: Star Wars Outlaws is "very focused" and not "too big" says dev
description: In a new interview, Star Wars Outlaws devs have given us an indication as to the size of the upcoming action RPG, and it's refreshingly manageable.

title: Sea of Thieves Season 10 pushed back to October, after devs make "difficult decision" to delay
description: Sea of Thieves Season 10 has been delayed for a couple of months to ensure quality and the best performance possible.

title: Marvel fans are trashing Secret Invasion's final episode – and it deserves it
description: Marvel fans aren't holding back on what they think of Secret Invasion's poor final episode.

title: Slack down? Users unable to send or receive messages
description: It's not just you - Slack isn't working for some users right now.

title: League of Legends fighting game Project L will be playable at EVO 2023
description: Upcoming League of Legends fighting game, Project L, will be playable in public for the first time at EVO 2023.

title: The Witcher season 3 ending explained: Henry Cavill's departure and more questions answered
description: TechRadar tries to answer your biggest questions surrounding The Witcher season 3's final episode.
